Bachelor: Arts & Humanities, Business & Social Sciences, Language & Cultural, Medicine & Health, Science & Technology
Master: Business & Social Sciences, Language & Cultural, Science & Technology
International Students: Yes, international applicants are welcome to apply for admission
Minority Serving: Alaska Native or Native Hawaiian-serving Institution
Undergraduate Profile: Four-year, medium full-time, inclusive, higher transfer-in institution
Undergraduate Instructional Program: Professions plus arts & sciences, some graduate coexistence
Graduate Instructional Program: Arts & sciences focus, no graduate coexistence
Library: Yes  University of Guam's library collection is comprised of both physical (i.e. books, medium etc.) and digital/electronic items. In 2018 the library has reported 120,060 physical volumes, 13,056 physical media and 127 licensed digital/electronic databases. University of Guam's library has 1 branch.
Housing: Yes University of Guam provides on-campus housing. The total dormitory capacity, whether on or off campus, was about 218 students in the 2018 academic year.
Institutional Accreditation: WASC Senior College and University Commission
Memberships and Affiliations: Association of Public and Land-Grant Universities (APLU),International Assembly for Collegiate Business Education (IACBE)
Overview: Founded in 1952,  University of Guam is a non-profit public higher-education institution located in the rural setting of the large town of Mangilao (population range of 10,000-49,999 inhabitants).   Officially recognized by the WASC Senior College and University Commission, University of Guam (UOG) is a small (uniRank enrollment range: 4,000-4,999 students) coeducational Guamanian higher education institution. University of Guam (UOG) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as pre-bachelor degrees (i.e. certificates, diplomas, associate or foundation), bachelor degrees, master degrees in several areas of study. See the uniRank degree levels and areas of study matrix below for further details. This 68 years old Guamanian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy This higher education institution has an open admission policy. International students are welcome to apply for enrollment.  UOG also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library,  housing,  study abroad and exchange programs,  online courses and distance learning opportunities,  as well as administrative services.
